nodes.message: Chatted with Librarian enough times to get through to him.

nodes.text: Does it feel colder in the library than usual?
I do not notice the cold. I believe you are merely experiencing certain magical energies on a physical level.
What sort of magical energy?
The passageway has now been opened. That is all I will say on this matter.
What passageway?
(hard stare)
Do you know that there is an invasion of Warrior Drats in the castle? I don't see any around here...
Thomas has already informed me of the matter.
Do you have any suggestions on how to handle it? Has it ever happened in the past?
This event is unprecedented. However, I may have to take drastic actions to allow others to deal with this matter.
What sort of actions?
I will allow access to certain areas of the castle that have been heretofore inaccessible by an avoidance rune.
Where's that?
If you intend to take action upon this matter, then I suggest you do more research.
Have you had any problem with the School Thief in the library?
No. Thieves are not welcome here.

nodes.message: Allowing Shawn to talk to the librarian after completing the fetch quest, to get more information.

nodes.text: Do you know anything about someone named 'Red' who used to be an apprentice to the Knight Luminar Sir Hans?
Sir Hans was knight to the apprentice Rufus 'Red' McMurtry. After the death of his master, McMurtry went on to save Sardonia from an attack from pirates. He was declared to be Hero of Sardonia.
McMurtry was honored with a medal of honor. He then retired to raise a family. He eventually died in his sleep survived by his four children, fourteen grandchildren, and three great-grandchildren.
How do you know such things?
I read. It goes with the job description.
Is there some way I can prove this story to the ghost of Sir Hans? Is it written in some book I can borrow? Sir Hans was worried about Red's fate.

No. There is no book with that particular level of detail.  There are, however, many archived reports over the decades, none of which may leave the library. Nor are they accessible to students - particularly not Disbarred Bard students.
If you wish to reassure Sir Hans concerning his apprentice, I suggest you find other forms of proof within the castle.

options.text: Ask About Sir Jamus and Whim

nodes.message: Allowing Shawn to talk to the librarian after completing the fetch quest, to get more information.

nodes.text: What do you know about Sir Jamus and his horse, Whim?
Sir Jamus and Whim were part of the founding of the Knights Luminar. They were a team in Albion during the destruction of Londinium in the Dark One war.

There are no details about what Whim really was or how Sir Jamus met him. There has been speculation that it was the magical bridle that shaped a spirit of the wind into the form of a horse at Jamus' command.
It was said that Jamus would converse with Whim although only Jamus could hear Whim's answers. Each evening, Jamus would take off Whim's bridle, and Whim would be set free to roam at will.

On the night that Sir Jamus died from a traitor's poison, a terrible storm rose up unexpectedly and the winds wailed like banshees. Whim never returned to the castle after that, nor was he seen again.
I found this library book lying around the castle where someone must have dropped it.
Ah, I see that I shall be revoking Mr. Kent's borrowing privileges for mislaying this book.
I appreciate your effort to return this book to its proper place.
Is there a book that shows the layout of this castle before it became a school?
Unfortunately for your purpose, there are no such books or manuscripts. However, I am certain that you are capable of uncovering some of the less obvious areas of the castle on your own.
I will only suggest that you search where you do not want to go.
Do you have any books about fighting against the Undead?
The general advice given to anyone who asks about how to defeat Undead is - Don't. Don't even try. Leave such tasks to Paladins or trained Death Stalkers.
However, there is a book in the Martial Arts section N3 that might be useful to you - "Defense Against the Undead."

If, despite my warning, you choose to take arms against the Undead, you had better have a magical weapon and magical protections. Otherwise, it is likely that the Death Stalkers will one day be hunting your own Undead remains.
Where can I find the Disbarred Bard Books?
Q1 and Q2.

options.text: Say Something Polite to Compliment the Librarian

nodes.text: Thank you. Clearly, you have this place well organized. Would you please tell me if the Q section is at the far end of the library or this end?
The Disbarred Bards sections are on the balcony level nearest to this end of the room.
Thank you, sir.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Show Interest In the Library

nodes.text: So... is the library labeled clockwise starting at the southeast? Do you designate which floor books are on, or does the same scheme work for both levels?
I suggest you find those answers out for yourself, but you are essentially correct.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Annoy the Librarian

nodes.text: Could you translate that to human, please? I don't speak Librarianese.
Southeastern section of the balcony.
No.
Where can I find the Rogue books?
I have been informed by the Headmaster that there are no 'Rogue' books in this library.
The 'Disbarred Bards' section is Q1 and Q2.
Where can I find the books on Thief Skills?
There are no books in the category of 'Thief Skills' here in the library. I believe that the assumption is that Thieves are seldom literate.
Do you have any books on magic?
Books on Magic are restricted to Wizard students only.
I am a Magic student.
Indeed? However, there is a significant difference between Magic and Wizardry.
What's the difference?
Magic books are restricted to Wizard students.
Where can I find a book on 'Tricksters?'
Can you give me a hint where that is?
On the balcony next to the portrait of Vasili. That should suffice.
So are there any good books that I should read?
All books in this library are 'good.' It is entirely up to you to determine whether a given book or subject matter is useful.
Do you have any books on ropes or grapnels?
Do you have a book on how to play Poobah?
"The Tao of Poobah" is found at M1-5.
Where can I find a book to improve my throwing skills?
Where can I find a book on Lockpicking?

options.text: Give a Gift to the Librarian

nodes.text: Would you like to have an apple?
Why would you assume that I would like to have your apple?
Well, people give apples to teachers, don't they? You may not be a teacher, but I'm certainly learning things from here. So I thought maybe you would like to have an apple.
I'm not entirely certain I followed your disjointed line of reasoning or fathomed your motivations. However, assuming that the apple which you offer to me is neither rotten nor poisoned, I accept it.
I presume that there are no ulterior motives to this gift other than a futile attempt to curry my favor?
Um... sure?
Very well. Offer accepted.
Yes, thank you.
Would you like to add this book to the library?
That book is already on the shelf here in considerably better shape than the one you offer. Do not dog-ear pages like that - find yourself a bookmark.
Would you like to have this strange book I found?
What sort of book is it? Let me take a look at it, please.
My word! This book - where did you find it? Were there any more books like it?
I think I found it lying around in a hidden passageway under the Hall of Heroes. I didn't see any other books around there.
If you ever come across a book like this again - or see anything like it in your explorations - inform me immediately. This is an extremely dangerous item!
So what is it? I mean, it's just a book...
JUST a book??? Knowledge is always a dangerous thing - never underestimate its power.
This book is magical - a dark magic that should not exist on this world. I will make sure that it cannot again be used by the foolish or the wicked.
Would you like some very rare Dryad's Kiss wine?
I see that you have been exploring the wine cellar... That wine is highly desired by wine connoisseurs, probably worth a small fortune to the right collector. However, I have no interest in it.
Would you like to have this bottle of wine, sir?
I do not drink. If you are trying to favorably improve my opinion of you, you will need to take another approach.
I brought you a rose, sir.
You brought me a lover's token as a gift? I suggest you redirect your attention and affections to someone who will reciprocate them.
Would you like to have this book I came across? It's sort of a song book, I guess.
Allow me to look at it, please.
A book of maudlin love ballads... how quaint. Not precisely the sort of reference book we need in this library, but I suppose from a completest point of view I should add it to the collection.

I appreciate your attempt to contribute to the library's font of knowledge, but as a point of reference, I prefer books that are factual rather than fictional espousers of foolish fantasies about emotional bonds.
Would you like to have this Paladin book, sir? I came across it in my explorations.
I believe we already have a copy of that book on the shelves. No, thank you.
Part of the wall is magic, over by the globe and the painting.
I think it might be a secret door. But I can't figure out how to get it open.
You're not going to answer the question?
You have not asked any questions.
Is that a secret magic door? And if so, where does it go?
The concealed passage leads to the Magic section of the Library.
Great! How do I get it open?
Only Wizards may enter that section of the Library. Since you are not a Wizard, you cannot 'get it open'.
Furthermore, none of the books back there would be of use to you.
